ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Neo-baroque at its full extent. I would recommend it because it makes the student question an think in depth.

The course was mainly focused on the most important novel written by JosÃ© Lezama Lima: Paradiso. This author is included in the literary trend known as Neobarroco, and consequently we analysed this trend and its relationships with the Baroque period (Spanish, through Luis de GÃ³ngora; and Latin American, through Sor Juana InÃ©s de la Cruz).I would strongly recommend this course to students interested in Modern Latin American literature, because it is center on one of its key figures.
An excellent immersion, with many a great insight, in Latin American literature, taught by a legend in the field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Helped me to learn how to think better and know a lot more about Latin American (especially Cuban) literature.

Thanks to this course I have deepened my knowledge of the Modern Cuban literature, specifically of JosÃ© Lezama Lima, a key figure of Modern literature written in Spanish.I have not decided the main topic of my research yet, so it was not crucial for it. But the course showed me potential lines of study.
